com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad

Class Joystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad.Joystick
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThreeAxisJoystick, TwoAxisJoystick

    public class Joystick
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a simple interface for interacting with a typical joystick. The buttons have been given names to avoid depending on their printed labels.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns a new Vector2 representing the state of the joystick.
      JoystickAxisState getJoystickAxisState()
      Returns the state of the joystick axes together in a JoystickAxisState.

      Returns the current value of the x-axis of the joystick.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Joystick

        public Joystick(int port)
        Constructs a new Joystick given its port number.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number of the joystick to be read.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the current value of the x-axis of the joystick.
        A value of -1 indicates that the joystick is fully left.
        A value of 1 indicates that the joystick is fully right.
        Returns:
        The current value of the x-axis of the joystick.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the current value of the y-axis of the joystick.
        A value of -1 indicates that the joystick is fully down.
        A value of 1 indicates that the joystick is fully up.
        Returns:
        The current value of the y-axis of the joystick.

      • getJoystick

        public Vector2 getJoystick()
        Returns a new Vector2 representing the state of the joystick. The Vector2 contains the state of the x- and y- axes of the joystick.
        Returns:
        A Vector2 representing the state of the joystick.

      • getJoystickAxisState

        public JoystickAxisState getJoystickAxisState()
        Returns the state of the joystick axes together in a JoystickAxisState.
        Returns:
        A JoystickAxisState object containing the states of all the axes on this Joystick.

      • trigger

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.buttons.Button trigger()
        Returns a Button object representing the trigger of the joystick.
        The trigger is the large button on the front of the joystick. It is shaped like a trigger.
        Returns:
        A Button object for the trigger.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a human-readable String form of this Joystick object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A human-readable String representing this Joystick.
